nodes.name: Get video details
nodes.notes: Make a call to the YouTube API so that we have the thumbnail for the email and the duration to filter out shorts.

nodes.name: Schedule Trigger
nodes.notes: This scheduleTrigger node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Filter out shorts
nodes.notes: Sometime, some live broadcasts that are then posted as regular videos do not have a duration. That is why we check if `duration` is present in `contentDetails`.

nodes.name: Sticky Note

parameters.content:
### Default frequency: every hour
Changing it here is enough if you want to check for new videos at a higher or lower frequency. You don't have to edit anything else.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
### Get my subscriptions from the YouTube Data v3 API
You can expect to use 1 quota per 50 subscriptions per run, which is well within the 10 000/req a day allowed by default.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
### Get the 15 latest videos of each channel with RSS
Using the YouTube API instead would cost too many quotas to make it viable.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
### Call YouTube's API for more data
We need the thumbnails for the email and the duration to filter out shorts.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note4

parameters.content:
### Configure your email here
To go to the video from the email, simply click on the thumbnail.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Get latest 15 videos of each channel
nodes.notes:
YouTube provides an RSS feed for each channel with the 15 latest videos.
We use this instead of the YouTube Data v3 API, as search requests cost a lot of "quota points" and would easily put us over the daily limit with just one workflow run.

nodes.name: Get my subscriptions
nodes.notes: Get subscriptions from YouTube Data v3 API

nodes.name: Check for errors
nodes.notes: This if node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Only keep channels with unwatched videos
nodes.notes: It's not a perfect indicator for new videos but helps reduce the amount of channels to process.

nodes.name: Keep only videos published since last run
nodes.notes: We dynamically figure out the last run's execution time through the settings of the "Schedule Trigger" node.

nodes.name: Send an email for each new video
nodes.notes: The expression in the HTML for the thumbnail simply selects the last element of the thumbnails array so that we get the best possible resolution thumbnail available.

parameters.html:
=

{{ $json.snippet.title }}
parameters.subject: ={{ $json.snippet.channelTitle }}

nodes.name: If the HTTP request failed, throw the error
nodes.notes: This stopAndError node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Split out subscriptions to process individually
nodes.notes: This splitOut node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content:
## Manually filter out channels
To find the channel ID of a channel, click on the description → Share channel → Copy channel ID

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Youtube Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Youtube Workflow. This workflow integrates 10 different services: stickyNote, youTube, httpRequest, filter, scheduleTrigger. It contains 20 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 20
- **Node Types**: 10
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Get video details**: youTube
- **Schedule Trigger**: scheduleTrigger
- **Filter out shorts**: if
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note4**: stickyNote
- **Get latest 15 videos of each channel**: rssFeedRead
- **Get my subscriptions**: httpRequest
- ... and 10 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
